title: Connect to ADFS 3.0
body:
### Expected behaviour

Connect to ADFS 3.0 
### Actual behaviour

with ADFS 3.0 the user cannot connect at all, and more institutions move towards ADFS 3.0 so this issue is much higher priority
### Steps to reproduce

With an ADFS 3.0 institution of us states the android client isn't capable of "SNI (Server Name Indication)" -  a feature of SSL TLS and both Web Application Proxy and AD FS 2012 R2 use 
it to enable simpler deployment and remove networking prerequisites.

While the customer are trying to find a workaround, maybe engineering can have a look at your end if it is possible to cope with SNI.
### Environment data

Android version: 1.9.1

@MorrisJobke @rperezb 

[00005104](https://na25.salesforce.com/5003100000Z4xlh)

title: Bump support libs to 23.3
body:
I would like to bump the support libs to v23.3
This is basically a gradle change plus replacing the corresponding ant dependencies in the lib folder plus some extra files in there to make the ant build work. 
Exemplary thing we would get:
- vector drawables - which might only be usable when we drop ANT support, so no benefit for now
- the recycler view implementation has been updated to also support wrap_content and auto layouting (though we don't use the recycler view yet)
- we can than add a day/night theme if we want to
- custom tab as in better support to open a webpage within the app itself

Details: http://android-developers.blogspot.de/2016/02/android-support-library-232.html

Any opinion on this? @davivel @tobiasKaminsky @przybylski @malkomich

title: Use toolbar instead of actionbar where applicable
body:
Like the title says use the toolbar - Google's new, to be used implementation of the top bar instead of the action bar which can be considered legacy. 

**Motivation**
The actionbar is simply a bar which can have a menu, search widget and in newer AppCompat versions also a drawer implementation but isn't as flexible as the toolbar.

**Reasons and benefits**
The toolbar can be customized on many ways like but not limited to:
- adding any kind of views to it, like the progressbar which would be nice especially when 
  - we integrate the multi select branch (no dark blue line below the then grey bar)
  - no dark blue line below the bar when the drawer is opened
- animate it, like scrolling it away on a list/recycler view which seems nice on the file browsing views
- the material drawer can be full height, like mentioned in #1210 because this is only possible for the toolbar not the action bar (it can be done with hacks though)

I would like to work on this in case we agree this is worth implementing which I strongly suggest to make the bar future proof and also to be able to implement the above mentioned gimmicks.

So pinging @davivel @jancborchardt  @malkomich @tobiasKaminsky and @przybylski for feedback on this matter.

title: Continues Wifi-only upload when not on wifi
body:
### Expected behaviour

The app is performing a long-running wifi-only upload (in my specific case, triggered by instant upload triggered by me being briefly near my home). I then leave wifi range within a few seconds of entering it. The app should suspend the ongoing upload (because I told it on its settings page that I only want it to upload on wifi).
### Actual behaviour

The app proceeded to drain my data allowance by continuing to upload on an (unfortunately very fast LTE-based) cell network.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Start wifi-only upload
2. Leave wifi range
3. Watch it drain your data allowance
### Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1r22

Device model: One plus One

Stock or customized system: Cyanogenmod nightly from Mar 21

ownCloud app version: 1.9.1 from FDroid

ownCloud server version: 8.2

title: Move file via uploader
body:
When sharing a file with owncloud it is now possible to choose between copy and move, just like in the upload from within our app.
But in despite of this the default is always copy (as e.g. no one wants to move whatsapp images to owncloud as this might break the app).
Of course it can happen that a file is moved during sharing that cannot be moved (e.g. a cached image), then it will just copy it and fails silently.

title: ownCloud app don't open the last revision of a modified file
body:
### Expected behaviour

When you open a file in the ownCloud app, it should show you the last version of the file (the one on the server).
### Actual behaviour

When you open the ownCloud app it check if there is updated files and see them. Then when you open a file that you have previously updated on your computer (that is synced to the server) the ownCloud app show you a previous version of the file.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Modify a file from your ownCloud folder on your computer
2. Sync it to the server
3. Open it in the ownCloud app on your Android phone
### Environment data

Android version: 4.4 

Device model: Razr i

Stock or customized system: CM11

ownCloud app version: 1.9.1

title: Fix New Folder Alertdialog padding
body:
New Folder Alertdialog padding is not right. EditText expands to the both edges.

According to [Material Design guidelines](https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/dialogs.html#dialogs-specs), Alertdialog should have `24dp` padding on left and right sides and `20dp` between title and content.

**Here is how it currently looks.**
![4 march 2016 105454 pm ist](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/841656/13534840/1d1d2286-e25d-11e5-8d73-b550e8d55407.png)

**Here is the added padding according to Material Design guidelines.**
![4 march 2016 105522 pm ist](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/841656/13534850/2a1c0eac-e25d-11e5-86c7-b3e84bdd04e5.png)

title: Reliable uploads -  UPLOADS VIEW
body:
@owncloud/android-developers 

Time has come.

From my POV, this is finally ready to be tested by QA (cc @jesmrec).

Many hands contributed here, starting with the awesome effort of @LukeOwncloud. Sounds wise summoning many eyes to review it. So, any comment about the code will be welcome.

Though many things have been rewritten and considerably cleaned-up, sure you will still find many points that could (and should) be refactored. I can't promise that all of them may be attended in this PR, since we really, really, need to release this with next version 1.9.2, that should be very near in time to the release of OC 9. Evolution of testing is the leading criteria right now. 

This means: if we think we can refactor something in a safe manner without introducing an important risk for QA, we will do. If bugs appear and the code to fix is also subject of comments in the code review, we will apply the comments. 

But if change requests are big enough to require QA starts the testing all over again, we will have to wait for a better chance.

This one should not be too far in time. This PR lets aside an important topic that was originally addressed by @LukeOwncloud , the improvement of automatic retries. Right now instant uploads are retried when Wifi connection is established, in a similar way to the operation of the currently released version 1.9.1 [1]. But other convenient improvements will be addressed specifically in the short term [2], not in this PR. And that should be a good moment to improve the code of uploads further.

Come on Barbie, let's go party!

[1] You may notice some light improvements, but that's a side effect of the many changes done; was easier let it that way that adding artificial limits. Have fun finding them :)

[2] If you don't want to wait and prefer to implement them, go for it. Just mention me to let me know, and I'll try to help.

---

title: Doubled PROPFIND when pressing back in folder view
body:
### Expected behaviour

I noticed that there are very many PROPFIND entries in my apache log. In particular there are two very similar entries when I browse up if the folder hierarchy.
### Actual behaviour

Only one PROPFIND per back press.
### Cause

On clicking back variable `ignoreETag` should be false:
https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/src/com/owncloud/android/ui/activity/FileDisplayActivity.java#L1255

However, this value is "lost" here...

https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/src/com/owncloud/android/ui/fragment/ExtendedListFragment.java#L362

...because the `OnRefreshListener` does not allow parameters for `onRefresh()`.
### Environment data

ownCloud app version: 1.9.1 (master as of today)

title: Improve CONTRIBUTION and SETUP docs
body:
1. `git checkout master remotes/origin/master` should be changed to `git checkout master` to avoid error `error: pathspec 'remotes/origin/master' did not match any file(s) known to git.`
2. [CONTRIBUTION.md](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [SETUP.md](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/SETUP.md) have exactly same problematic instruction as mentioned in point 1 in different wordings. I think it's a good idea of remove the setup procedure from [CONTRIBUTION.md](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and solely rely on  [SETUP.md](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/SETUP.md) for setup guide.
3. Corrected numbering in [CONTRIBUTION.md](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
4. Corrected a spelling error.

title: using Feedback option results in receiving a NDR
body:
### Expected behaviour

The feedback option creates a new e-mail message to incoming2@owncloud.com. We expect this address to exist, delivering our e-mail message containing the feedback content.
### Actual behaviour

The mailbox does not exist, according to ownCloud's mail server, kerio.owncloud.com. It results in a NDR being sent back.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open the Settings
2. Tap 'Feedback' in the bottom of the Settings screen
3. Produce e-mail message and tap the send button
4. Receive e-mail message, it's a NDR, containing: incoming2@owncloud.com (kerio.owncloud.com: Mailbox does not exist)
### Environment data

Android version: 5.1.1

Device model: Sony Xperia Z5 Compact (E5823)

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 1.9.1

ownCloud server version: 8.2.2

title: Downloads fail on mobile clients after server changed ssl key (browsing works fine, iOS also affected)
body:
### Expected behaviour

Server changed SSL key after expiry (self signed certificate).
Clients should ask for accepting self signed certificate and then work fine
### Actual behaviour

Browsers and desktop clients correctly recognize new certificate, ask for overriding self signed and work fine after accepting.
Mobile clients (Android and iOS) continue browsing repository, but fail to download and upload files (without any error message in client or server - not sure about this but didn't find anything).
### Steps to reproduce
1. Use Server with self signed SSL certificate
2. Create profile on mobile clients
3. Let server certificate expire
4. Change server certificate to new self signed certificate
5. Browse files with mobile client and try to download or upload files
### Workaround
- delete profile on mobile client
- recreate profile on mobile client (offline data keeps present, but certificate is validated)
### Environment data

Android 4.1.2 and iOS 9.2.1

ownCloud app version:
current (1.9.1) on Android, current (17.02.2016) on iOS

ownCloud server version:
8.2.2
### Logs

[Wed Feb 17 23:20:27.719478 2016] [authz_core:error] [pid 18301] [client x.x.x.x:47288] AH01630: client denied by server configuration: /var/www/owncloud/data/htaccesstest.txt
(only message since last apache restart)

<empty>

title: download failed message shown
body:
## environment

ownCloud Android app v1.9.1
## expected behaviour

If a file download fails, a message should be displayed with detailed information about the file and file path which has failed. Additionally it should be possible to show a list of files to be download/synchronized which also allows to remove a file from that list.
## current behaviour

If a file download fails, a message is displayed which doesn't show the full file name nor the file path which has failed. It is also not possible to show a list of files to be downloaded/synchronized nor is it possible to remove a file from that list because the original file path is might be unknown or the file has already been deleted in the meantime.

title: Move to compile target Marshmallow (Android 6 - v23) - rebased without FAB
body:
This Branch is _not_ based on material_fab.

Works for gradle and ant.

What has been done so far:
- [x] Bumped compile target to 23
- [x] Bumped AppCompat to 23.1.1
- [x] Bumped build tools to 23.0.2 - same for the travis build
- [x] Fixed MediaService implementation
  - Moved on to NotificationCompat.Builder (as it is done in all aother placed within the app) since the Notification.setLatestEventInfo() has been removed with Android M, see http://developer.android.com/about/versions/marshmallow/android-6.0-changes.html#behavior-notifications
  - added the material design "play button" icon for the notification/system bar
- [x] Added AppCompat Design lib 23.1.1
- [x] Fixed dependencies on deprecated Apache HTTP API in Android framework.
- [x] ONGOING: v23 permission API calls for write access to external storage (necessary since compile target has been bumped to 23) --> to follow around #1343 
- [x] DONE- runtime permission check for CONTACTS group due to GET_ACCOUNTS permissions; check if this permission is strictly needed (MANAGE_ACCOUNTS is not in CONTACTS group, and maybe it's all that we need)
